meanings.sent1: After reaching the other side, she had to recross the bridge to get back home.
meanings.sent2: He realized he forgot his keys and had to recross the street to retrieve them.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to recross the road multiple times just for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts recrossed the memories of her childhood, bringing back a flood of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The hiker had to recross the river, carefully stepping on the rocks to avoid getting wet.

meanings.sent1: The cat liked to recross the same path in the garden every day.
meanings.sent2: They had to recross the finish line due to a technical error in the race.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to recross the playground to play one more game before going home.
meanings.sent4: His mind would often recross the same worries, making it hard to focus on the present.
meanings.sent5: The bird had to recross the sky to find its lost feather, flying in circles above the trees.
